column4: I've been unable to to boot my system for about a week because GRUB is broken and I haven't been able to fix it; does anyone here know about encrypted filesystems and fixing GRUB from a live CD?
have you tried supergrubdisc2 to boot/get in and then repair?
no, I hadn't heard about it.
its a small is image to search 4 and recover grub2
I downgraded GRUB to legacy, so will it still work for me?
i think supergrubdisk is also available.... its just really simple thats all.....
broken grub you say?
yeah, it gives me an error saying no init found.
that sounds like you have edited the kernel boot string and messed up!?
did you edit /boot/grub/grub.conf manually?

I downgraded to legacy Grub, and then I think I did sudo update-grub, but then I had to edit menu.lst manually because it had an incorrect pathname for root= since I was running from a live CD chrooted to my encrypted filesystem
so I had to change root= to the hexadecimal name, although I'm not sure whether I was supposed to change it to the encrypted partition, the boot partition, or what
confirm the initrd entry.....
just a second, let me open menu.lst.
oh, ok - encryption.... not sure!!
initrd line says /initrd.img-2.6.32-27-generic (and similar entries for the different kernels)
and I tried update-initramfs
which keeps giving me an error saying "cryptsetup: WARNING: invalid line in /etc/crypttab -".
encryption = me no know...... do you have no other kernel in the list to boot?
I do, so I can try them, although the entries are all similar.  Do you know if supergrubdisk will work with an encrypted filesystem?
no idea, sorry
thanks.  I'll read the documentation and see.
!encrypt | potiphera *maybe* something there??

thanks, I think this is slightly different because it's full disk encryption.  But I am able to mount the disk using the live CD.  I am going to go read the documentation for supergrubdisk and disk encryption, but thanks again.
